supporting_text.text: Satya nadela thank you so much for doing this I want to be very very respectful of your time

… to me whenever there's been a real platform shift the core application architectures have changed right ... I think that something of that scale or if not more is going to happen again with the application logic right and this time around the thing about agents is they are not going to be bound to essentially anyone's SAS application and its data ... that is what's going to be the change ...

… right now in my own use case I go to co-pilot I say at sales which is actually touching Dynamic CRM brings back whatever the account information then it brings back information from Office 365 I put it into pages I share it with people the entire workflow … I never … nobody uses it because you know when was the last time I logged into CRM never except now I'm every day querying my CRM database because it's so much easier because it's one agent away and it's working with all the other agents …

… it's a swarm of Agents … when you hire a data analyst you don't you hire them and their spreadsheets … I already see that right … I have a simple agent now which is a SharePoint agent that I'm always addressing and it's fantastic not to just have to go to a separate entity and you know query it but to have it right there …

… there's a design space that is not narrow … that's why we are building out Foundry such that we can even be distribution for people who are building purpose-built models for Industries … so we’re going to bring them customers … the design space is large enough … there will be in every layer of the tech stack opportunities for innovation …

… one has to deal with both the pace and the scale of innovation is to be very good at sampling with agility … you can’t say I'm going to build this and then I'll go to next … you have to be simultaneously working with some Frontier thing … while you're optimizing that …

… if you care about hallucination there are thousand ways to get rid of hallucinations like grounding … if really you don't want to use an llm go use just regular machine learning … that’s why I think evals are important …

properties.name: Foundry (Microsoft Distribution Platform for AI Models)

supporting_text.text: … that's why we are building out Foundry such that we can even be distribution for people who are building purpose-built models for Industries … you can build a great llm … for different Sciences … for different Industries …
